SEARCH
Package music

Class MusicLibrary

java.lang.Object
music.MusicLibrary
All Implemented Interfaces:
SongManagement
public class MusicLibrary extends Object implements SongManagement
The MusicLibrary class represents the music library that stores songs organized by genre. It follows the Singleton design pattern to ensure that only one instance of the music library exists.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static MusicLibrary getInstance()
      Static method to retrieve the singleton instance of the music library. If the instance does not exist, it is created.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of the music library.

    • getGenre

      public Genre getGenre(String genreName)
      Retrieves the genre with the specified name from the music library.
      Parameters:
      genreName - The name of the genre.
      Returns:
      The genre object, or null if the genre does not exist.

    • getSongsForGenre

      public List<Song> getSongsForGenre(String genreName)
      Retrieves all songs for the specified genre.
      Parameters:
      genreName - The name of the genre.
      Returns:
      A list of songs belonging to the genre.

    • getSongForGenre

      public Song getSongForGenre(String genreName, String songTitle)
      Retrieves a song with the specified title for the specified genre.
      Parameters:
      genreName - The name of the genre.
      songTitle - The title of the song.
      Returns:
      The song object, or null if the song does not exist in the genre.

    • getAllSongs

      public List<Song> getAllSongs()
      Retrieves all songs stored in the music library.
      Returns:
      A list of all songs in the music library.
